name: Tiraggo
tagline: A C# Cross Platform ORM Architecture (Full Xamarin Mono Touch Support)
body:
The Nomadic Architecture ======= A C# Cross Platform ORM Architecture with full Xamarin Mono Touch Support

Copyright Â© Mike Griffin. All Rights Reserved.
Mikes [Personal Site](http://www.tiraggo.com)
Mikes [Twitter Account](https://twitter.com/TheBrewDawg) ##NuGet Package## [Nuget Package for Tiraggo] (https://www.nuget.org/packages/Tiraggo.SQL/) ##Platforms Supported## * Windows - include the standard project files into your solution * iPad/iPhone - include the .iOS project files into your solution * Android - include the .Android project files into your solution * Mac OS X Lion - include the .Mac project files into your solution ##How To Generate your Business Objects## * [Register on My2ndGeneration.com] (https://www.my2ndgeneration.com/) * Download the Cross Platform Client (Windows, Mac, Linux) * Push your Database Schema (Metadata only) up to the My2ndGeneration cloud. * Generate the Tiraggo Custom and Generated Classes * Click on the "Zip" button and download you classes ##Cloud Code Generation## [Video Presentation] (http://www.tiraggo.com/movies/Tiraggo_Cloud.html) ##Desktop Code Generation## [Video Presentation] (http://www.tiraggo.com/movies/Tiraggo_Desktop.html) [Download My2ndGeneration Desktop] (https://www.my2ndgeneration.com/content/My2ndGenerationDesktop.zip) ##Live Tiraggo/Tiraggo.js/Knockout Application## [Run the Live Application] (http://www.tiraggo.com/tiraggo/wcfservice/Editing.aspx) ##Tiraggo's Endless Possibilities## ##Databases Supported## * Microsoft SQL Server * Microsoft SQL Azure * Oracle * MySQL * SQLite (including on iPhone/iPad/Android) * SQLCipher (SQLite w/256-bit AES encryption of database files) * PostgreSQL * Sybase (not yet online but next in the queue) ##The github Repository## [Full Source is Available Here] (https://github.com/BrewDawg/Tiraggo) ##The Tiraggo.js JavaScript Architecture## [Tiraggo.js] (http://brewdawg.github.com/Tiraggo.js/)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
